p: Anthropogenic emissions (from combustion of fossil fuels) and biogenic emissions from soils are the main sources of NO in the atmosphere ( Medinets et al., 2015). In the troposphere, NO quickly oxidizes to nitrogen dioxide (NO 2). NO and NO 2 (termed as NO x) may react with volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and hydroxyl, resulting in organic nitrates and nitric acid, respectively. They access ecosystems through atmospheric deposition that has an impact on the N cycle as a result of acidification or N enrichment ( Pilegaard, 2013).
